newsitem.title: USA: TENNIS-SARGSIAN, STEVEN REACH FINAL OF HALL OF FAME.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SARGSIAN, STEVEN REACH FINAL OF HALL OF FAME.

text.p: Fifth seed Sargis Sargsian of Armenia advanced Saturday to his first career ATP Tour final to face eighth seed Brett Steven of New Zealand for the $255,000 Hall of Fame Tennis Championships title.
The 24-year-old Sargsian, ranked 86th in the world, beat seventh seed Leander Paes of India 7-6 (7-3) 2-6 6-3.
Steven surprised third seed Grant Stafford of South Africa 6-3 5-7 6-4.

Sargsian, the 1995 U.S. national collegiate singles champion while attending Arizona State, won twice in 1996 and reached the final in Bermuda in April on the Challenger circuit -- a junior series that does not count toward the ATP.
Steven has ousted the third and second seeds in his past two matches. This is the first time Steven reached a final since doing so in his native Auckland in 1996.
